page.title: 07Housing
page.content: The housing in Donisthorpe is of varied appearance.Along the main street,one struggles to see two houses alike.Most of the dwellings date from the early part of the century and reflect the equitable building climate of that time. The result is a village of well constructed buildings of individual architecture. There are two small council estates of terraced, rendered houses. There is also a strip of modern bungalows. The most curious feature concerns a rather imposing dwelling of three stories on the Moira Rd, for it has had a spacious bungalow built in its front garden. Netherseal presents a different character. Around a nucleous of large sandstone Edwardian dwellings an expanse of modern 3 and 4 bedroomed houses have been constructed.
